author: See Kee Oon J:
casenumber: General Division of the High Court — Criminal Case No 47 of 2018
casename: Public Prosecutor v Gaiyathiri d/o Murugayan
counsel: Mohamed Faizal SC, Senthilkumaran Sabapathy and Stephanie Koh (Attorney-General’s Chambers) for the Prosecution; Sunil Sudheesan and Diana Ngiam (Quahe Woo & Palmer LLC) for the Accused (up to 30 March 2021); Joseph Chen (Joseph Chen & Co) for the Accused (wef 30 March 2021).

headings.text: Facts
Use of criminal force under s 352 of the Penal Code (DAC-902724-2018)
Criminal intimidation under s 506 of the Penal Code (DAC-902770-2018)
Voluntarily causing hurt by means of a heated substance under s 324 read with s 73(2) of the Penal Code (DAC-902753-2018)
Voluntarily causing hurt under s 323 read with s 73(2) of the Penal Code
Wrongful restraint under s 341 of the Penal Code (DAC-902830-2018)
Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by starvation under s 325 read with s 73(2) of the Penal Code (DAC-902842-2018)
Culpable homicide under s 304(a) of the Penal Code
Autopsy report
Diminished responsibility – the Accused’s psychiatric conditions
Brief procedural background
The parties’ submissions on sentence
Prosecution’s submissions
Defence’s submissions
Issues to be determined
The applicable sentencing principles in the present case
The mitigatory weight to be placed on the accused’s psychiatric conditions
Life imprisonment in relation to mentally disordered offenders
Relevance of prosecutorial discretion to reduce the charge
The appropriate sentence for the s 304(a) charge
The appropriate sentences for the remaining charges
Consecutive sentences and the totality principle
Conclusion

tags: Criminal Procedure and Sentencing/Sentencing/Mentally disordered offenders
